00035   /* Basic CVODE constants */
00036 
00037 #define ADAMS_Q_MAX 12     /* max value of q for lmm == ADAMS     */
00038 #define BDF_Q_MAX    5     /* max value of q for lmm == BDF       */
00039 #define Q_MAX  ADAMS_Q_MAX /* max value of q for either lmm       */
00040 #define L_MAX  (Q_MAX+1)   /* max value of L for either lmm       */
00041 #define NUM_TESTS    5     /* number of error test quantities     */
00042 
00043 #define HMIN_DEFAULT     RCONST(0.0)    /* hmin default value     */
00044 #define HMAX_INV_DEFAULT RCONST(0.0)    /* hmax_inv default value */
00045 #define MXHNIL_DEFAULT   10             /* mxhnil default value   */
00046 #define MXSTEP_DEFAULT   500            /* mxstep default value   */
00047 
00048   /*
00049    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00050    * Types : struct CVodeMemRec, CVodeMem
00051    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00052    * The type CVodeMem is type pointer to struct CVodeMemRec.
00053    * This structure contains fields to keep track of problem state.
00054    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00055    */
00056 
00057   typedef struct CVodeMemRec {
00058 
00059     realtype cv_uround;    /* machine unit roundoff */
00060 
00061     /*-------------------------- 
00062       Problem Specification Data 
00063       --------------------------*/
00064 
00065     CVRhsFn cv_f;        /* y' = f(t,y(t))                    */
00066     void *cv_f_data;     /* user pointer passed to f          */
00067     int cv_lmm;          /* lmm = CV_ADAMS or CV_BDF          */
00068     int cv_iter;         /* iter = CV_FUNCTIONAL or CV_NEWTON */
00069     int cv_itol;         /* itol = CV_SS or CV_SV             */
00070 
00071     realtype cv_reltol;  /* relative tolerance                */
00072     realtype cv_Sabstol; /* scalar absolute tolerance         */
00073     N_Vector cv_Vabstol; /* vector absolute tolerance         */
00074     CVEwtFn cv_efun;     /* function to set ewt               */
00075     void *cv_e_data;     /* user pointer passed to efun       */
00076 
00077     /*-----------------------
00078       Nordsieck History Array 
00079       -----------------------*/
00080 
00081     N_Vector cv_zn[L_MAX];  /* Nordsieck array, of size N x (q+1).         */
00082     /* zn[j] is a vector of length N (j=0,...,q)   */
00083     /* zn[j] = [1/factorial(j)] * h^j * (jth       */ 
00084     /* derivative of the interpolating polynomial  */
00085 
00086     /*--------------------------
00087       other vectors of length N 
00088       -------------------------*/
00089 
00090     N_Vector cv_ewt;     /* error weight vector                          */
00091     N_Vector cv_y;       /* y is used as temporary storage by the solver */
00092     /* The memory is provided by the user to CVode  */
00093     /* where the vector is named yout.              */
00094     N_Vector cv_acor;    /* In the context of the solution of the        */
00095     /* nonlinear equation, acor = y_n(m) - y_n(0).  */
00096     /* On return, this vector is scaled to give     */
00097     /* the estimated local error in y.              */
00098     N_Vector cv_tempv;   /* temporary storage vector                     */
00099     N_Vector cv_ftemp;   /* temporary storage vector                     */
00100 
00101     /*-----------------
00102       Tstop information
00103       -----------------*/
00104     booleantype cv_tstopset;
00105     booleantype cv_istop;
00106     realtype cv_tstop;
00107 
00108     /*---------
00109       Step Data 
00110       ---------*/  
00111 
00112     int cv_q;         /* current order                           */
00113     int cv_qprime;    /* order to be used on the next step       */ 
00114     /* = q-1, q, or q+1                        */
00115     int cv_next_q;    /* order to be used on the next step       */
00116     int cv_qwait;     /* number of internal steps to wait before */
00117     /* considering a change in q               */
00118     int cv_L;         /* L = q + 1                               */
00119 
00120     realtype cv_hin;    /* initial step size                      */
00121     realtype cv_h;      /* current step size                      */
00122     realtype cv_hprime; /* step size to be used on the next step  */ 
00123     realtype cv_next_h; /* step size to be used on the next step  */ 
00124     realtype cv_eta;    /* eta = hprime / h                       */
00125     realtype cv_hscale; /* value of h used in zn                  */
00126     realtype cv_tn;     /* current internal value of t            */
00127     realtype cv_tretlast; /* value of tret last returned by CVode */
00128 
00129     realtype cv_tau[L_MAX+1];    /* array of previous q+1 successful step     */
00130     /* sizes indexed from 1 to q+1               */
00131     realtype cv_tq[NUM_TESTS+1]; /* array of test quantities indexed from     */
00132     /* 1 to NUM_TESTS(=5)                        */
00133     realtype cv_l[L_MAX];        /* coefficients of l(x) (degree q poly)      */
00134 
00135     realtype cv_rl1;     /* the scalar 1/l[1]            */
00136     realtype cv_gamma;   /* gamma = h * rl1              */
00137     realtype cv_gammap;  /* gamma at the last setup call */
00138     realtype cv_gamrat;  /* gamma / gammap               */
00139 
00140     realtype cv_crate;   /* estimated corrector convergence rate     */
00141     realtype cv_acnrm;   /* | acor | wrms                            */
00142     realtype cv_nlscoef; /* coeficient in nonlinear convergence test */
00143     int  cv_mnewt;       /* Newton iteration counter                 */
00144 
00145     /*------
00146       Limits 
00147       ------*/
00148 
00149     int cv_qmax;        /* q <= qmax                                          */
00150     long int cv_mxstep; /* maximum number of internal steps for one user call */
00151     int cv_maxcor;      /* maximum number of corrector iterations for the     */
00152     /* solution of the nonlinear equation                 */
00153     int cv_mxhnil;      /* maximum number of warning messages issued to the   */
00154     /* user that t + h == t for the next internal step    */
00155     int cv_maxnef;      /* maximum number of error test failures              */
00156     int cv_maxncf;      /* maximum number of nonlinear convergence failures   */
00157 
00158     realtype cv_hmin;     /* |h| >= hmin       */
00159     realtype cv_hmax_inv; /* |h| <= 1/hmax_inv */
00160     realtype cv_etamax;   /* eta <= etamax     */
00161 
00162     /*--------
00163       Counters 
00164       --------*/
00165 
00166     long int cv_nst;              /* number of internal steps taken             */
00167     long int cv_nfe;              /* number of f calls                          */
00168     long int cv_ncfn;             /* number of corrector convergence failures   */
00169     long int cv_netf;             /* number of error test failures              */
00170     long int cv_nni;              /* number of Newton iterations performed      */
00171     long int cv_nsetups;          /* number of setup calls                      */
00172     int cv_nhnil;                 /* number of messages issued to the user that */
00173     /* t + h == t for the next iternal step       */
00174 
00175     realtype cv_etaqm1;      /* ratio of new to old h for order q-1        */
00176     realtype cv_etaq;        /* ratio of new to old h for order q          */
00177     realtype cv_etaqp1;      /* ratio of new to old h for order q+1        */
00178 
00179     /*----------------------------
00180       Space requirements for CVODE 
00181       ----------------------------*/
00182 
00183     long int cv_lrw1;        /* no. of realtype words in 1 N_Vector         */ 
00184     long int cv_liw1;        /* no. of integer words in 1 N_Vector          */ 
00185     long int cv_lrw;         /* no. of realtype words in CVODE work vectors */
00186     long int cv_liw;         /* no. of integer words in CVODE work vectors  */
00187 
00188     /*------------------
00189       Linear Solver Data 
00190       ------------------*/
00191 
00192     /* Linear Solver functions to be called */
00193 
00194     int (*cv_linit)(struct CVodeMemRec *cv_mem);
00195 
00196     int (*cv_lsetup)(struct CVodeMemRec *cv_mem, int convfail, N_Vector ypred,
00197                      N_Vector fpred, booleantype *jcurPtr, N_Vector vtemp1,
00198                      N_Vector vtemp2, N_Vector vtemp3); 
00199 
00200     int (*cv_lsolve)(struct CVodeMemRec *cv_mem, N_Vector b, N_Vector weight,
00201                      N_Vector ycur, N_Vector fcur);
00202 
00203     void (*cv_lfree)(struct CVodeMemRec *cv_mem);
00204 
00205     /* Linear Solver specific memory */
00206 
00207     void *cv_lmem;           
00208 
00209     /*------------
00210       Saved Values
00211       ------------*/
00212 
00213     int cv_qu;             /* last successful q value used                        */
00214     long int cv_nstlp;     /* step number of last setup call                      */
00215     realtype cv_h0u;       /* actual initial stepsize                             */
00216     realtype cv_hu;        /* last successful h value used                        */
00217     realtype cv_saved_tq5; /* saved value of tq[5]                                */
00218     booleantype cv_jcur;   /* Is the Jacobian info used by linear solver current? */
00219     realtype cv_tolsf;     /* tolerance scale factor                              */
00220     int cv_qmax_alloc;     /* value of qmax used when allocating memory           */
00221     int cv_indx_acor;      /* index of the zn vector in which acor is saved       */
00222     booleantype cv_setupNonNull; /* Does setup do something?                      */
00223 
00224     booleantype cv_VabstolMallocDone;
00225     booleantype cv_MallocDone;  
00226 
00227     /*-------------------------------------------
00228       Error handler function and error ouput file 
00229       -------------------------------------------*/
00230 
00231     CVErrHandlerFn cv_ehfun;    /* Error messages are handled by ehfun     */
00232     void *cv_eh_data;           /* user pointer passed to ehfun            */
00233     FILE *cv_errfp;             /* CVODE error messages are sent to errfp  */
00234 
00235     /*-------------------------
00236       Stability Limit Detection
00237       -------------------------*/
00238 
00239     booleantype cv_sldeton;     /* Is Stability Limit Detection on?         */
00240     realtype cv_ssdat[6][4];    /* scaled data array for STALD              */
00241     int cv_nscon;               /* counter for STALD method                 */
00242     long int cv_nor;            /* counter for number of order reductions   */
00243 
00244     /*----------------
00245       Rootfinding Data
00246       ----------------*/
00247 
00248     CVRootFn cv_gfun;     /* Function g for roots sought                     */
00249     int cv_nrtfn;         /* number of components of g                       */
00250     void *cv_g_data;      /* pointer to user data for g                      */
00251     int *cv_iroots;       /* int array for root information                  */
00252     realtype cv_tlo;      /* nearest endpoint of interval in root search     */
00253     realtype cv_thi;      /* farthest endpoint of interval in root search    */
00254     realtype cv_trout;    /* t value returned by rootfinding routine         */
00255     realtype *cv_glo;     /* saved array of g values at t = tlo              */
00256     realtype *cv_ghi;     /* saved array of g values at t = thi              */
00257     realtype *cv_grout;   /* array of g values at t = trout                  */
00258     realtype cv_toutc;    /* copy of tout (if NORMAL mode)                   */
00259     realtype cv_ttol;     /* tolerance on root location                      */
00260     int cv_taskc;         /* copy of parameter task                          */
00261     int cv_irfnd;         /* flag showing whether last step had a root       */
00262     long int cv_nge;      /* counter for g evaluations                       */
00263 
00264   } *CVodeMem;
00265 
00266   /*
00267    * =================================================================
00268    *     I N T E R F A C E   T O    L I N E A R   S O L V E R S
00269    * =================================================================
00270    */
00271   
00272   /*
00273    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00274    * Communication between CVODE and a CVODE Linear Solver
00275    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00276    * convfail (input to cv_lsetup)
00277    *
00278    * CV_NO_FAILURES : Either this is the first cv_setup call for this
00279    *                  step, or the local error test failed on the
00280    *                  previous attempt at this step (but the Newton
00281    *                  iteration converged).
00282    *
00283    * CV_FAIL_BAD_J  : This value is passed to cv_lsetup if
00284    *
00285    *                  (a) The previous Newton corrector iteration
00286    *                      did not converge and the linear solver's
00287    *                      setup routine indicated that its Jacobian-
00288    *                      related data is not current
00289    *                                   or
00290    *                  (b) During the previous Newton corrector
00291    *                      iteration, the linear solver's solve routine
00292    *                      failed in a recoverable manner and the
00293    *                      linear solver's setup routine indicated that
00294    *                      its Jacobian-related data is not current.
00295    *
00296    * CV_FAIL_OTHER  : During the current internal step try, the
00297    *                  previous Newton iteration failed to converge
00298    *                  even though the linear solver was using current
00299    *                  Jacobian-related data.
00300    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00301    */
00302   
00303   /* Constants for convfail (input to cv_lsetup) */
00304   
00305 #define CV_NO_FAILURES 0
00306 #define CV_FAIL_BAD_J  1
00307 #define CV_FAIL_OTHER  2
00308 
00309   /*
00310    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00311    * int (*cv_linit)(CVodeMem cv_mem);
00312    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00313    * The purpose of cv_linit is to complete initializations for a
00314    * specific linear solver, such as counters and statistics.
00315    * An LInitFn should return 0 if it has successfully initialized the
00316    * CVODE linear solver and a negative value otherwise.
00317    * If an error does occur, an appropriate message should be sent to
00318    * the error handler function.
00319    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00320    */
00321   
00322   /*
00323    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00324    * int (*cv_lsetup)(CVodeMem cv_mem, int convfail, N_Vector ypred,
00325    *                 N_Vector fpred, booleantype *jcurPtr,
00326    *                 N_Vector vtemp1, N_Vector vtemp2,
00327    *                 N_Vector vtemp3);
00328    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00329    * The job of cv_lsetup is to prepare the linear solver for
00330    * subsequent calls to cv_lsolve. It may recompute Jacobian-
00331    * related data is it deems necessary. Its parameters are as
00332    * follows:
00333    *
00334    * cv_mem - problem memory pointer of type CVodeMem. See the
00335    *          typedef earlier in this file.
00336    *
00337    * convfail - a flag to indicate any problem that occurred during
00338    *            the solution of the nonlinear equation on the
00339    *            current time step for which the linear solver is
00340    *            being used. This flag can be used to help decide
00341    *            whether the Jacobian data kept by a CVODE linear
00342    *            solver needs to be updated or not.
00343    *            Its possible values have been documented above.
00344    *
00345    * ypred - the predicted y vector for the current CVODE internal
00346    *         step.
00347    *
00348    * fpred - f(tn, ypred).
00349    *
00350    * jcurPtr - a pointer to a boolean to be filled in by cv_lsetup.
00351    *           The function should set *jcurPtr=TRUE if its Jacobian
00352    *           data is current after the call and should set
00353    *           *jcurPtr=FALSE if its Jacobian data is not current.
00354    *           Note: If cv_lsetup calls for re-evaluation of
00355    *           Jacobian data (based on convfail and CVODE state
00356    *           data), it should return *jcurPtr=TRUE always;
00357    *           otherwise an infinite loop can result.
00358    *
00359    * vtemp1 - temporary N_Vector provided for use by cv_lsetup.
00360    *
00361    * vtemp3 - temporary N_Vector provided for use by cv_lsetup.
00362    *
00363    * vtemp3 - temporary N_Vector provided for use by cv_lsetup.
00364    *
00365    * The cv_lsetup routine should return 0 if successful, a positive
00366    * value for a recoverable error, and a negative value for an
00367    * unrecoverable error.
00368    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00369    */
00370 
00371   /*
00372    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00373    * int (*cv_lsolve)(CVodeMem cv_mem, N_Vector b, N_Vector weight,
00374    *                  N_Vector ycur, N_Vector fcur);
00375    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00376    * cv_lsolve must solve the linear equation P x = b, where
00377    * P is some approximation to (I - gamma J), J = (df/dy)(tn,ycur)
00378    * and the RHS vector b is input. The N-vector ycur contains
00379    * the solver's current approximation to y(tn) and the vector
00380    * fcur contains the N_Vector f(tn,ycur). The solution is to be
00381    * returned in the vector b. cv_lsolve returns a positive value
00382    * for a recoverable error and a negative value for an
00383    * unrecoverable error. Success is indicated by a 0 return value.
00384    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00385    */
00386 
00387   /*
00388    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00389    * void (*cv_lfree)(CVodeMem cv_mem);
00390    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00391    * cv_lfree should free up any memory allocated by the linear
00392    * solver. This routine is called once a problem has been
00393    * completed and the linear solver is no longer needed.
00394    * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00395    */
00396   
00397   /*
00398    * =================================================================
00399    *   C V O D E    I N T E R N A L   F U N C T I O N S
00400    * =================================================================
00401    */
00402 
00403   /* Prototype of internal ewtSet function */
00404 
00405   int CVEwtSet(N_Vector ycur, N_Vector weight, void *e_data);
00406 
00407   /* High level error handler */
00408 
00409   void CVProcessError(CVodeMem cv_mem, 
00410                       int error_code, const char *module, const char *fname, 
00411                       const char *msgfmt, ...);
00412 
00413   /* Prototype of internal errHandler function */
00414 
00415   void CVErrHandler(int error_code, const char *module, const char *function, 
00416                     char *msg, void *eh_data);
00417

00423

00429 #define MSG_TIME_TOUT "tout = %Lg"
00430

00435 #define MSG_TIME_INT  "t = %lg is not between tcur - hu = %lg and tcur = %lg."
00436 #define MSG_TIME_TOUT "tout = %lg"
00437 
00438 #else
00439

00441 #define MSG_TIME_H    "t = %g and h = %g"
00442 #define MSG_TIME_INT  "t = %g is not between tcur - hu = %g and tcur = %g."
00443 #define MSG_TIME_TOUT "tout = %g"

00451 #define MSGCV_MEM_FAIL "A memory request failed."
